intro: Calobota obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate calobota, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Calobota obovata is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
